channel.title: Comments on: A Brief Psychohistory of Indian Politics- History Repeats Itself

item.title: By: Easwar
item.dc:creator: Easwar
item.description: True, if these young leaders are able to lead the campaign in the next 5 years, we have nothing to fear. But if they are still dependent on Modi to get them votes, it is something to worry about for the BJP.

item.title: By: deepakns
item.dc:creator: deepakns
item.description: Well... The key Amit Shah strategy is local churn. It seems Amitbhai is keen on bringing in local constituency wise strongmen into BJP/campaign for BJP. They then project Modi and campaign with development agenda. I have strong suspicion that this methodology was developed in Gujarat first, UP/Bihar for Lok Sabha and now in other areas. So history in the sense of Indra Gandhi will not repeat itself, but unless young leaders learn the trick of the game from Modi/Shah in the next 15 years, then the model will become unsustainable.
